p: In R. gallica L. the oil has a typical geraniol pattern [ 16]. The level of hydrocarbons is also very high. As a rule, the content of methyleugenol is low. This rose is widely grown in the countries of the former Soviet Union. The processing technology in these areas has other traditions and for this reason the composition of the oil is often quite differentâ€”phenylethyl alcohol is the major component [ 5].
